resources.string: To complete a level, score 20 points.
" The Arabic word for \"digit\" means \"zero\". Later, this word was used to refer to any digit."

" Roman numerals were used in the Roman Empire. Nowadays, they are used to refer to centuries, months. They can be seen on the watch faces.\n And it is also interesting that there is no \"zero\" in Roman numerals."
Guess the hidden numbers in the pictures and select the largest one.
" The number eight is considered the number of perfection, balance and cosmic order. It is associated with infinity, and is also a symbol of love and friendship."
Guess the hidden numbers in the pictures and select the even one.
" Any number divisible by two without a remainder is considered an even number."
" In some countries, they are happy to eat what is considered inedible in others. For example, in France, frog legs are a delicacy."
Select something that, from a culinary point of view, is a fruit or berry.

" Is tomato a vegetable or a fruit?\n Europeans call fruits soft juicy fruits. This is the only reason why you can call a tomato a fruit plant.\n In Russia, they are skeptical about this: we do not add tomatoes to sweet dishes, do not pour ice cream juice on them, do not treat children with it as sweets. Therefore, for our country, tomato is only a vegetable."
Which is the first month of the year?
" Previously, the New Year was celebrated on 14, January. The Old New Year is an additional holiday that resulted from a change in the chronology."

" All animate objects in the world are created by nature. These are plants, animals, fungi, and bacteria. Inanimate nature includes: sun, air, water, mountains, rocks, sand, sky, stars. In the same way, everything that is made by human hands belongs to the inanimate objects.
" Scientists suggest that the goat was one of the first animals to be domisticated."
" Bears are considered to be one of the most dangerous predators on Earth. They live in almost every corner of the globe, including the North Pole."

" Since the roosters and hens began to be domesticated, their way of life has changed dramatically. There was no longer any need to escape from predators. There was no need to move from place to place in search of warmth and food. People put them in covered houses and gave them a lot of food. So these birds became completely domestic and lost the ability to fly at all."
" The blue whale is not only the largest animal of the ocean, but also of the entire planet."
Choose an object that makes sounds.
" Sound is vibration transmitted through a solid, liquid or air. Sound does not propagate in a vacuum."

" The human world has largely acquired its usual modern appearance due to the huge variety of metals found in the earth's crust. They provide the opportunity for industrial enterprises and agriculture to work."
Choose something that has to do with sports.
" Important components of a healthy lifestyle are: proper nutrition, compliance with the daily routine and, of course, sports.
" Cryptozoology is a pseudoscience and subculture that aims to prove the existence of entities from the folklore record.

" In the eggshell, there are a huge number of tiny pores. Through them, oxygen penetrates inside and carbon dioxide leaves. The embryo receives nutrients from the yolk. The yolk is a storeroom where supplies are stored until the baby hatches from the egg.
